Method Detail

rotate

protected BinarySearchTree.Node rotate()
Description copied from class: BinarySearchTree.Node
This method is called for the son of the rotation, i.e. after the rotation the son is the new father-node. This method calls fixRotation() (for the new son) and fixAggregate() (for father and son). It is assumed, that the aggregates of the parents of the new root of the subtree are not affected.
Overrides:
rotate in class BinarySearchTree.Node
Tags copied from class: BinarySearchTree.Node
Returns:
Node - this

fix

protected void fix(int index)
Description copied from class: BinarySearchTree.Node
This method is called when a structural change occured (e.g. during an insert()- or remove()-operation)) in one of the subtrees. In a BinarySearchTree-Object this method has nothing to do. It is usually overwritten in subclasses.
Overrides:
fix in class BinarySearchTree.Node
Tags copied from class: BinarySearchTree.Node
Parameters:
index -  
See Also:
AVLTree, RedBlackTree
